name: Pope St. Alexander I
summary: Alexander I was Bishop of Rome from approximately 107 to 115. According to tradition, he was martyred during the reign of Emperor Trajan or Hadrian. He is credited with introducing the use of holy water and adding the words 'Qui pridie quam pateretur' to the Eucharistic prayer. He also established the tradition of blessing houses with holy water. His feast day is celebrated on May 3 in the West and March 16 in the East.
